snippet: Lt. Gordon Matthew Ambelas, who became trapped during a search for residents during the fire Saturday, was the first New York City firefighter to die in the line of duty in more than two years, the authorities said.
abstract: Lt Gordon Matthew Ambelas, 14-year veteran, is the first New York City firefighter to die in the line of duty in more than two years; Ambelas and team of firefighters responded to routine fire in Brooklyn and was trapped during search for residents, becoming badly burned and unconscious; details of events remain murky but preliminary investigation indicates fire was started by air conditioner power cord.

byline.original: By VIVIAN YEE and AL BAKER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Annie Correal, Emma G. Fitzsimmons, J. David Goodman and Nate Schweber.

lead_paragraph: Lt. Gordon Matthew Ambelas, who became trapped during a search for residents during the fire Saturday, was the first New York City firefighter to die in the line of duty in more than two years, the authorities said.

headline.main: Known for Rescues, a Firefighter Dies in a Brooklyn Blaze
headline.print_headline: Known for Rescues, a Firefighter Dies in a Brooklyn Blaze
